title: Noctes ambrosianae,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Never was there sic a terrible treeo as them o Yarrow Ford, Ettrick Pen, and Bourhope ! Three decenter tailor lads, a week afore, ye micht hae searched for in vain ower the wide warld.

title: Noctes ambrosianae,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: For, wad ye believe t, the mad body was aff ower the hills, and bat* Watty o Ettrick Pen ! Of coorse he strack and in his turn aff by a short cut to the Lochs, and bat Bauldy o Bourhope, wha loupt frae the buird like a puddock.

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Never was there sic a terrible treeo as them o' Yarrow Ford, Ettrick Pen, and Bourhope ! Three decenter tailor lads, a week afore, ye micht hae searched for in vain

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: For, wad ye believe 't, the mad body was aff ower the hills, and bat * Watty o' Ettrick Pen ! Of coorse he strack — and in his turn aff by a short cut to the Lochs, and bat Bauldy o' Bourhope, wha loupt frae the buird like a puddock, and slang the guse in the fire, swearin by the shears, as he flourished them round his head, and then sent them intil the ass-hole, that a' mankind  micht thenceforth gang nakit for him up to the airm- pits in snaw !

title: Noctes Ambrosianæ.
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Never was there sic a terrible treeo as them o' Yarrow Ford, Ettrick Pen, and Bourhope ! Three decenter tailor lads, a week afore, ye micht hae searched for in vain ower the wide warld.

title: Noctes Ambrosianæ.
author: Wilson, John
snippet: For, wad ye believe't, the mad body was aff ower the hills, and bat* Watty o' Ettrick Pen ! Of coorse he strack — and in his turn aff by a short cut to the Lochs, and bat Bauldy o' Bourhope, wha loupt frae the buird like a puddock.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The Hartfell group of mountains is the highest in the south of Scotland, and the heights of the principal summits are as follows  : — Hartfell, 2G41 feet above the level of the sea ; Whitecorn  (looking down on Loch Skene), 2685 ; Broadlaw (in Peeblesshire, and Tweedsmuir parish), 2741 ; Ettrick Pen, 2256; Saddleback and Lochcraig, not ascertained.
